action.content: Turn 0

You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the pillow on the table, the book on the table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a plate and a counter. The cupboard is closed. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
> open cupboard
Turn 1
The cupboard is now open. The cupboard is empty.
> take pillow
Turn 2
You can't see a pillow here.
> go to living room
Turn 3
You are in a living room now. There are a table, a book, a shelf, a chair, a side table and a couch. The book is on the side table. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.
> take book
Turn 4
You take the book. In your inventory you have a book.
> go to kitchen
Turn 5
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a plate and a counter. The cupboard is open. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
> put book on table
Turn 6
You can't see a table here.
> go to living room
Turn 7
You are in a living room now. There are a table, a shelf, a chair, a side table and a couch. There are passages to a hallway and a kitchen here.
> put book on table
Turn 8

> go to kitchen
Turn 9
You are in a kitchen now. There are a cupboard, a plate and a counter. The cupboard is open. The plate is on the counter. There are passages to a pantry, a hallway and a living room here.
> take plate
Turn 10
